result.execSummary:
The defendant Linda L Fuller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Handling of Burning Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called: 16CF574, 16CM388 & 16CM57, Defendant Linda L Fuller in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Victims rights complied with. NGI plea withdrawn. ADA Crystal Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1,2,3 in 16CF574 and count 1 in 16CM57. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentence on count 1 in 15CF574, 3 years probation. Conditions: $528 costs. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Complete psychological evaluation and treatment. On counts 2&3, 7 months jail on each, consecutive to each other, commence forth with. Huber granted under jail rules. $253, $243 costs. In 16CM57, 2 years probation. Same conditions as in 16CF574, $443 costs. Jail credit: 16CF574, 305 days applied to counts 2&3. No credit on count 1. 16CM57, 2 days. 16CM388 included in 16CF574 credit. Count 4 in 16CF574 and 16CM388 read in and dismissed.
Plea hearing on October 2, 2017 at 11:00 am.
for a Plea Hearing 9/29/17 at 2:45 P.M., Br. 3
State's Witness List filed by ADA Crystal Long

Defendant Linda L Fuller in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  William Albert Appleton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Substitution was filed by atty Riek on this case last March, she questioned if Judge Hepler can take the plea. Court agreed this case can not go forward today due to the substitution request back in March. This will stay on the trial calendar.
Plea hearing on September 26, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

16CF574 called. Defendant Linda L Fuller in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of Information waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea and NGI plea. New evaluation would encompass all 3 cases. Evaluation to be completed in 60 days. Dr. Berney to do evaluation.

Defendant Linda L Fuller in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State called witness Det. Bagnall. Direct examination. Cross examination. Redirect. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court found probable cause. Bound defendant over for further proceedings. 30 days to file information. This will be set for arraignment with Br. 3 at a separate time.
for prelim on 2/23/17 2 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Linda L Fuller in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr. Brad Smith appeared by phone.  Report by Dr. Smith was received and reviewed by counsel.  Defendant agreed with Dr.'s report.  Feels she is competent to proceed.  Dr. Smith found defendant is competent.  Court found defendant competent.  Matter will be set for return with her other case.  They will track together.   9:06/9:09
